The period between 1927 and 1948 in Hollywood is often known as the [studio era](https://breakingsmart.substack.com/subscribe?utm_medium=rss&utm_content=37129116). The era began with the introduction of sound in movies, which increased cost and complexity, and ended with anti-trust legislation against the big, vertically integrated studios, resulting in a separation of distribution and production.
